org.threadly.litesockets.buffers

Class SimpleMergedByteBuffers

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.litesockets.buffers.AbstractMergedByteBuffers
      • org.threadly.litesockets.buffers.SimpleMergedByteBuffers
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MergedByteBuffers

    public class SimpleMergedByteBuffers
extends AbstractMergedByteBuffers
    This is a lower overhead Implementation of MergedByteBuffers. It is not appendable and can only process the buffers it is constructed with.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.threadly.litesockets.buffers.MergedByteBuffers

        BYTES_IN_INT, BYTES_IN_LONG, BYTES_IN_SHORT, UNSIGNED_BYTE_MASK, UNSIGNED_INT_MASK, UNSIGNED_SHORT_MASK

      Discard will drop how ever many bytes you tell it to on the floor.
      void discardFromEnd(int size)

    • Method Detail

      • duplicate

        public SimpleMergedByteBuffers duplicate()
        Description copied from interface: MergedByteBuffers
        Make a complete duplicate of this MergedByteBuffer. Both references should function independently, but they are still using the same ByteBuffer backing arrays so any change to the actual byte[] in the backing ByteBuffers will change in both.
        Specified by:
        duplicate in interface MergedByteBuffers
        Specified by:
        duplicate in class AbstractMergedByteBuffers
        Returns:
        a new MergedByteBuffers object that duplicates this one, but works independently.

      • duplicateAndClean

        public SimpleMergedByteBuffers duplicateAndClean()
        Description copied from interface: MergedByteBuffers
        This will flush all the data in this MergedByteBuffer into another MergedByteBuffer.
        Specified by:
        duplicateAndClean in interface MergedByteBuffers
        Specified by:
        duplicateAndClean in class AbstractMergedByteBuffers
        Returns:
        a new MergedByteBuffer with the data that was in the original one.

      • popBuffer

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer popBuffer()
        Description copied from interface: MergedByteBuffers
        Get the next Complete ByteBuffer in its entirety. This byteBuffer could be any size and it will just pull it off the queue and return it. If MergedByteBuffers.remaining() is 0 you will get an empty ByteBuffer.
        Specified by:
        popBuffer in interface MergedByteBuffers
        Specified by:
        popBuffer in class AbstractMergedByteBuffers
        Returns:
        the next ByteBuffer in the queue.

      • hasRemaining

        public boolean hasRemaining()
        Description copied from interface: MergedByteBuffers

        Returns if there is any data pending in this MergedByteBuffer or not. This can be more efficient then calling MergedByteBuffers.remaining() on some implementations of MergedByteBuffers.

        Specified by:
        hasRemaining in interface MergedByteBuffers
        Specified by:
        hasRemaining in class AbstractMergedByteBuffers
        Returns:
        the current about of space remaining in the MergedByteBuffers.

      • discardFromEnd

        public void discardFromEnd(int size)
        Description copied from interface: MergedByteBuffers
        Similar to MergedByteBuffers.discard(int) except that the bytes removed from this will be from the end of the buffer and discard towards the head.
        Parameters:
        size - the number of bytes to discard.
